paper_abstract: Human interactive proofs (HIPs) are Internet security measures to avoid automated attacks. The authors focus on a new HIP: Capy CAPTCHA. Analyzing its design for flaws and weaknesses, they propose a low-cost, side-channel attack and extend their work to other image recomposition CAPTCHAs.
paper_title: Using JPEG to Measure Image Continuity and Break Capy and Other Puzzle CAPTCHAs
